subject: Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4)
msgSnippet: ... Probably not. This was more about demonstrating a technique than anything else. ... I don t think it does. Do you? -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger ::
messageBody:
David Saff wrote:
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> > What I find strange in all this is that I demonstrated doing what JUnit
> > does in another piece of code, and even people who use JUnit looked at
> > me like I was high.[2] Why the double standard? Why does JUnit get to
> > use this pattern and I don't. It's just weird, so I'm looking for an
> > explanation by asking the more general question, "What's so bad about
> > Pluggable Selector?"
>
> Was your other piece of code going to be reused as heavily as JUnit is?

Probably not. This was more about demonstrating a technique than
anything else.

> Does that make a difference?

I don't think it does. Do you?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
